questions.question: During the UV spectrophotometric analysis, a DNA sample showed an A₂₆₀/A₂₈₀ ratio of 1.45. What does this indicate?

answers.a: The DNA is pure and intact
answers.b: The DNA is contaminated with RNA
answers.c: The DNA sample has protein contamination
answers.d: The DNA concentration is too low

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true regarding the purity of nucleic acids?

answers.a: RNA and DNA both absorb maximally at 280 nm
answers.b: The A₂₆₀/A₂₃₀ ratio indicates protein contamination
answers.c: A₂₆₀/A₂₈₀ ratio of ~2.0 suggests pure RNA
answers.d: A₂₆₀/A₂₈₀ ratio below 1.0 indicates very pure DNA

questions.question: The absorbance at 230 nm primarily reflects contamination from:

answers.b: Salts, organic solvents, and chaotropic agents

questions.question: In agarose gel electrophoresis, intact chromosomal DNA appears as:

answers.a: A sharp, single band near the top of the gel
answers.c: Multiple sharp bands of different sizes
answers.d: A faint streak near the bottom

questions.question: If DNA bands appear as a smear rather than discrete bands, what is the most likely reason?
The direction of DNA movement in agarose gel electrophoresis is due to:

answers.a: Positive charge on the phosphate backbone
answers.b: Negative charge on the phosphate backbone
answers.c: Neutral charge on the sugar-phosphate backbone

questions.question: During electrophoresis, why are samples mixed with loading dye before being loaded into wells?

answers.c: To make the sample denser and visible during loading

questions.question: A student obtained fluctuating readings on the spectrophotometer. The most probable cause is:
Which of the following statements best explains the principle of agarose gel electrophoresis?

answers.a: DNA fragments are separated according to their charge density
answers.b: DNA fragments are separated based on molecular weight and size
answers.c: DNA fragments are separated by sequence composition
answers.d: DNA fragments move randomly through the gel

questions.question: What safety precaution must be observed when using ethidium bromide?

answers.b: Use nitrile gloves and dispose of gels properly as hazardous waste
answers.c: Mix it with buffers before heating
answers.d: It is safe to use without PPE
